TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ECDsaCng extends System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa

Docs.summary: Provides a Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class derives from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa> abstract base class.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng> class to sign a message and how to use the signature to verify that the message has not been altered.
[!code-csharp[ECDsaCng#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/ecdsacng/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ECDsaCng#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/ecdsacng/vb/program.vb#1)]

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a random key pair.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The random key pair has a public key length of 521 bits.

Docs.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes are not supported on this system.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 keySize) cil managed

Docs.param: The size of the key. Valid key sizes are 256, 384, and 521 bits.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a random key pair, using the specified key size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The random key pair will have the public key length defined by the `keySize` parameter.

Docs.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes are not supported on this system.
specifies an invalid length.

MemberSignature.Value: public ECDsaCng (System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve curve);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve curve) cil managed

Docs.param: The curve used to generate the public/private key pair.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class whose public/private key pair is generated over the specified curve.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `curve` must validate (that is, it must return `true`) when passed to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve.Validate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method and must be either a named or explicit prime.

Docs.exception: does not validate.

Docs.param: to include private parameters; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Exports the key used by the Elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) object into an object. If the key was created as a named curve, the field contains named curve parameters; otherwise, it contains explicit parameters.
Docs.returns: The key and named curve parameters used by the ECC object.
Docs.exception: An error occurred while obtaining the curve values.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm HashAlgorithm { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm HashAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the hash algorithm to use when signing and verifying data.
Docs.value: An object that specifies the hash algorithm.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property accepts the following algorithms: <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.MD5%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha1%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha256%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha384%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha512%2A>.
Other custom hash algorithms may also be used.
The default algorithm is <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha256%2A>.
This property is not used if you are signing or verifying data that is already hashed.

Docs.exception: The value is .

MemberSignature.Value: public override void ImportParameters (System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters parameters);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void ImportParameters(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters parameters) cil managed

Docs.param: The curve parameters.
Docs.summary: Replaces the existing key that the current instance is working with by creating a new for the parameters structure.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `parameters` contains only <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Q>, only a public key is imported. If `parameters` also contains <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.D>, a full key pair is imported. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Curve> field specifies the type of the curve to import.

Docs.exception: does not contain valid values.
references a curve that cannot be imported.
references a curve that is not supported by this platform.

MemberSignature.Value: public byte[] SignData (byte[] data);
.method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] SignData(unsigned int8[] data) cil managed

Docs.param: The message data to be signed.
Docs.summary: Generates a signature for the specified data.
Docs.returns: A digital signature for the specified data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method generates a signature for the specified data by hashing the input data using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.HashAlgorithm%2A> property, and then signing the result.
The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags?displayProperty=fullName> flag is required if the Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) key is not randomly generated by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng> object.

Docs.exception: is .
The key information that is associated with the instance does not have a private key.
Docs.permission: for permission to sign data. Demand value: . Associated enumeration:
